poem:
"Metropolis of Industry"

Upon dawn's grace, machines jitter awake,
60% heavier, their hunger unabated.
Kaleidoscope of earth's offerings, taken without leave,
The elegy for trees and stones unwritten.
By 2060, our regret will sigh in the winds,
Stories of sparrows vanished, rivers pale and thin. 
Do we tread the path of remembrance or ruin?
Merely shadows of our choices in the end.
